biography.value: The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry.

Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 19 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Magma erupts from a point on the ground the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it, creating a 20-foot-high, 5-foot-radius geyser. Each creature in the geyser’s area must make a [[/save dex 15 format=long]], taking [[/damage 6d6 type=fire average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
  • A tremor shakes the lair in a 60-foot radius around the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}. Each creature other than the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} on the ground in that area must succeed on a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.
  • Volcanic gases form a cloud in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} until the end of its turn. While &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned} in this way, a creature is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Red Dragon’s Lair

Red dragons lair in high mountains or hills, dwelling in caverns under snow-capped peaks, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized red &Reference[dragon]{dragon} lairs, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a &Reference[dragon]{dragon} as it sleeps.

With its hoard well protected deep within the lair, a red &Reference[dragon]{dragon} spends as much of its time outside the mountain as in it. For a red &Reference[dragon]{dragon}, the great heights of the world are the throne from which it can look out to survey all it controls—and the wider world it seeks to control.

Throughout the lair complex, servants erect monuments to the dragon’s power, telling the grim story of its life, the enemies it has slain, and the nations it has conquered.

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary red dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Small earthquakes are common within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair.
  • Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally warm and tainted by sulfur.
  • Rocky fissures within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair form portals to the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of &Reference[fire]{Fire}, allowing creatures of &Reference[elemental]{elemental} &Reference[fire]{fire} into the world to dwell nearby.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.
